description:
Ever since I switched from Windows to Linux I missed the simple ability to hit the Windows Key + . to invoke a global emoji picker that works regardless of the app you're working in.

There are some minor performance problems but they've been reduced over a steady stream of updates. Day one install on all my systems from now on.
summary: Exactly what I was looking for

description: I cannot get the picker to copy to my clipboard and the extension does not function either.

command: flatpak run it.mijorus.smile
shortcut: Super + T

run in background

Does the job very well. After using Windows emoji picker, I'll have to get used to the fact that it doesn't immediately insert the emojis, but has to paste them after closing the window. Other than that, UI feels 100% native. Thanks for making that

It's very handy to have an emoji picker that I can open quickly with a keyboard shortcut, and use with any app.

The custom tags feature is great for me because I use certain emoji for special purposes in my todo lists. I can tag and search by the meaning I have assigned, instead of having to remember the default tags.
summary: I love the custom tags option!

description: does what it is soupposed to do

This is great by itself, on Gnome, as it visually fits very well into the system.
It's even better when you install the Gnome Extension so it automatically pasts the emoji in.

It's not as fast as a built in solution, but really only takes a fraction of a second.
Absolutely love it!
summary: Perfect when paired with the Gnome Extension

description:
Allows you to select emoji and close automatically. Better than the default ibus-emoji picker which needs you to pick and press escape 2 times just to get out of that window.

For the desktop mode just go into settings->keyboard shorcuts and reassign the default emoji picker to a random shortcut. Then you can assign this to super + . with the instructions in the app.
No puedo entender cuál es el punto en hacer que la aplicación se cierre por completo cada vez que seleccionás un emoji. Si necesitás seleccionar más de un emoji es un dolor.

Buena app. Está mejor que la versión oficial de Gnome, aunque aún falta por mejorar. En este momento no posee traducción al español.

Con respecto a otro comentario... Por defecto cuando eliges un emoji la app se cierra para no molestar mientras lo pegas. En configuración está la opción para que se minimice al seleccionar y no se cierre. Para elegir más de un emoji se puede presionar la tecla Shift. Esta información aparece en la información de "Atajos".
很好的支持，值得在每个发行版为个人内置
